So many times we have gotten into trouble for treating or not treating the acute pathology based on their wrong readings. 
The chief receives your complaint emails and deletes them without further action. 
Your complaints about quality issues are considered dangerous and god forbid you put them in writing , you will be called  "a disruptive physician"
The newly hired associates are expected not to have any opinion until they become partners. The outdated partners threaten the new hires (who are not always young ) that if they disagree they won't be voted in for partnership. 
Expect this : whenever you call a partner  he will ask you " how long have you been at kp " as if this is mayo Rochester !!! 

The not so competent  partners are usually rehired as per diem after they retire and good luck getting them to do productive work !

pros: Excellent pay, excellent medical, varied shifts
cons: Management is a joke.  The middleman who has no real decision making power but would like you to think they do! Union is an even bigger joke "Labor/Management Partnership".  Impossible for them to adequately represent you when they have the same supervisor you do and managers have access to 100% of your calls.  If they look/listen long enough they will find a tiny detail left out and write you up for it.  No kudos, ever!

pros: Wonderful collaborative colleagues, excellent health care benefits, professional office environment, ability to transition to other roles.
cons: Micro-management sometimes an issue. Overtime often expected in order to ensure deadlines are met, and employees often assume job responsibilities of employees who leave company. Both reasons cause challenges with work/life balance.

pros: You will not find better benefits or pay.  Three different companies tried to hire me but could not get close.
cons: The relationship between KP and the labor union has its pros (good pay and benefits)  and cons (MANY ridiculous rules).   For example,  getting "dinged" if clocking in three to five minutes too late or to early-- probably placed due to lazy employees).

job_title: Associate IT Engineer in Pleasanton, CA
pros:
- Great Company to work for in the Healthcare Industry
- Much needed youthful outlook and assistance
- A Great emphasis on work life balance 
- Supports a strong company culture and values with the patients / members in mind
cons: - Slow paced work with a lot of red tape around every corner due to the many rules and regulations.

review_title: kaiser can be one of the best places to work and receive care.
pros: Good pay, with a strong union. The union helps control the employers big headed ways and works to give back ownership to the people who truly do the work.
cons: Management thank that it is there job to try to fire people, to the point that they forget how to actually manage there departments.

review_title: KP-IT has lots to offer in terms of interesting work but a few key IT leaders spoil it for so many.
pros: Kaiser is on the forefront of using technology for health care.
cons: Constant leadership changes (in the IT area) lead to too many start and stops that impede operational and cultural maturity.

review_title: Nice place to work if you do not want career advancement!
job_title: Medical Lab Assistant in Baltimore, MD
pros:
6 Percent  raise a year along with a 2,000 bonus and free health insurance.
Great pay! Union is a plus for health care workers.
cons:
no room for career advancement,
the union is also bad because it is hard to fire employees. no matter how well or unwell you do your job, everyone gets the same raise no matter what because of the union.
managers favor others.
Kaiser will not be around forever, just like the auto industry, their pension plans and retiree benefits are going to be their downfall.

pros: Generally compassionate to employees.  Inclusive in approach.  Employee engagement is good. Recognizes good employees but does not do enough to retain them.
cons: Slow decision making.  Consensus based approach is their achilles heel.  Work load is not equitable. Lots of people get away with slacking on the job.

review_title: Uncertain times but have confidence in executive management
pros:
-Health Benefit are great but may change.

-Good work life balance.

-Job Security.
cons:
- Organization is extremely large.  It's often difficult to find the correct person to address the issue.  So creating a list of contacts and creating meaningful relationship will help you.

-Red Tape

-Career Development:  It could take a long time to hear any news when you apply for a position even if you are an internal candidate.

job_title: Senior Project Manager in Washington, DC
pros: Good compensation, good company values, diverse workforce. Great health care provided to all employees. Good opportunities to work at multiple facilities.
cons: Senior management not in tune with how many of their front-line managers use intimidation, not respect to manage their employees.

review_title: Kaiser Permanente is one of the best private industry healthcare companies to work for.
job_title: Health Information Correspondence Technician in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Excellent health care benefits. Has union representation for most positions.  If you are hired as a union employee, it is very easy to change positions within the company due to union seniority preference.
cons: Non union employees can get overlooked for positions if a union employee applies.  Salary increases for non union are minimal.

review_title: Seniority plays a huge role, be aware if you are part of a unioned profession.
pros: A lots of growth potential on your career path if you are smart and hard working, AND know the right people along the way.
cons: As with anywhere else, politics is something that you will definitely run into.  Be prepared to handle conflicts that has nothing to do with your performance.

job_title: Lead Project Manager in Pleasanton, CA
pros: Beatiful campus, wonderful ammenities, food and expresso machines!! Work life balance is easy to accomodate, right off the expressway or BART, beautiful people with wonderful stories of life and love!
cons: Elevators sometimes smelly, jagged rocks protruding from around trees, gym closes way too early, food should be available ti 5 for late workers, parking lot is very hot if you don't park in garage

review_title: Great company to work for and enjoyed my time there.
job_title: Medical Assistant in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Among the best pays in the area for MA's
Great Benefits for full time employees 
Great learning environment for anyone
Great company culture
cons:
Limited scope depending on area
Management can be great but some not so much
Seniority plays a big part on days off and who gets what 
Employees with the most seniority will be always push back to change and are very highschool like

pros: great benefits and great pay. good time off accumulation
cons: I know some people hate it here but for me it was the opposite. I started off as a temp for about almost a year and that was really the only con for me but once i was hired permanently I loved it.  I guess people's experience really depends on what department you're in but for me personally, I love Kaiser and I don't want to leave here.

review_title: here until something better comes along
pros: It's a job with a paycheck.
cons: My only experience is with the KPHC project which is splendid display or incompetence and nepotism. Nearly all promotions go to (usually inexperienced and unqualified) offspring of senior KP people or college buddies of a particular mid-manager. Advance planning consists of putting out the fires caused by the lack of planning.

review_title: the left hand should know what the right hand is doing
pros: There's a lot of opportunity for growth and new jobs but, I hate that you have to manage your relationship or else people black ball you
cons: overall it's a good place to work once you have great managers and leadership assisting you with your career growth.

pros: benefits. people, location, ease, leadership, communication, compensation, morale, balance, fairness. overall, i can walk away from the day adn not worry about the pros and cons of owning my own business
cons: stress, corporate, impersonal, location, unorganized, low pay, patients, lack of communication, toxic environment, i feel like they only think of the bottom line not the patients themselves just saving the company money

review_title: Overall great company but careless in support of their managers
pros: There are people that really do care about providing quality healthcare and are dedicated to the companies mission.
cons: Employees tend to be overworked with long work hours with little reward to go with it.  Also, there is a tolerance of bad managers.  There is a lack of good flow of communication from top down.  Bad behavior from managers and co-workers is not addressed.

review_title: Constant 'turn around mode' at Kaiser Ohio Region
pros: benefits,pto, good computer system(s), cell phone discount
cons:
never positive feedback to employees, management not hands on, department heads often get away with no show work days, too many managers, unions control company
was passed up for a promotion for an outside employee hire, department leadership run their departments in a bubble

review_title: A great organization to work for! They encourage leaders to promote staff from within, so you feel a great support.
pros: Family-oriented, Great Benefits, Awesome Mid-level Leadership Team, Pay is decent.
cons: Improve Quality of Work/Life Balance. Most of the front line staff are labor union contracts.

review_title: A company with a serious mission
pros: The place is full of very, very dedicated and talented people, with solid clinical and technical background.  The overall culture is great, with a lot of sharing of information.  It has also has a great work/home balance and great benefits.
cons: Kaiser seems to be more dedicated to their Thrive marketing campaign then actually implementing it for their employees.  In addition, a lot of the non-California markets are not doing well, and Kaiser has recently sold the Ohio region.

pros: Great place to advance in your career because the company  hire within; managed by union rules.
cons: Their are Medical assistances, and LVS doing Registered Nurse job functions. This is not a MAGENET hospital raising nursing performance for public; so higher education not required. Assistance personal unsafe in ambulatory settings.

review_title: Overall a good company with good employee benefits.
pros: The company itself provides fine compensation and good employee benefits.  Each region (eg. Northern California, Southern California) functions separately and could be very different.
cons: Bad leadership. Low morale.  Constant turnover of staff in my region (both at the management level and the support staff level).

review_title: Overall great company to work for...
pros: Great benefits, plenty of employee involvement and events. Depending on departments and job, most are flexible. Many long-term employees. Opportunity to advance is available and depends on timing can be plenty.
cons: Depending on department and management - can be hard to fix bad management. HR are too close to managers and will require outside help to deal with issues. Other departments and managements may not be the case - most are wiling to help make things better.

review_title: Corporate side of this company is completely dysfunctional
pros:
1. Good pay
2. decent benefits
3. Many nice people
cons:
1. Crazy inept managers, especially at executive level.
2. Information Technology is extremely hostile to internal staff
3. Lotus notes, IBM, and IE8. Nuff said.
4. They said they want to hear your opinion, but call you insubordinate if you actually offer it.

pros: The focus on the community and our members is admirable.
cons: Does not have competitive salaries to the industry, not focused on strengths to fit job roles, low possibility for growth, no real rewards for performance in some areas. Poor leaders are kept in leadership positions with no leadership skills.

pros: Kaiser strives to be a leader in Health IT and is open to using a variety of technologies to deliver patient centric care.
cons: As with other large healthcare organizations, the process from identifying technologies to implementation is slow.

review_title: KP needs to invest in those who invest in themselves
pros: The benefits are good (maybe even great); however, the rest of the investment from Kaiser is just okay: okay pay, okay facilities, okay
cons: Lack of development of talented employees.  The leadership has a lack of foresight. Also, the investment in employees who are investing in their education is extremely low.

pros: The pay and benefits are excellent
cons: It is difficult to advance, especially if you want to go into management

review_title: Put in your time and you'll move up the ladder
pros: Hour long lunch (hour and fifteen on the weekends), onsite gym and full locker rom w showers, onsite yoga classes, benefits-although you have to use kaiser for medical services
cons: Volume of patients, culture of 'not my problem', little possibility of moving up the career ladder unless you've been working there a significant amount of time. People were advanced to clinical positions for which they had little clinical knowledge .. But they'd been there forever.

pros: Kaiser knows its mission and works to it every single day.  While I am new to the organization, you can already start to see the impact it has had on the company that it was before (Group Health).
cons: No real cons at the moment,  the two companies are still integrating.

pros:
Excellent benefits
Competitive salaries
Supportive Union-Management partnerships
Caters to individual's work place comfort
Opportunities for community service, additional training beyond job description, education, advancement, etc.
cons: work experience is a must, sometimes education does not fully suffice consideration for employment

pros: I love Kaiser. Once you get in the door you have room to grow. They pay excellent and their benefits are amazing.
cons: Sometimes its all about who you know then your skills. Also the union can be hard to deal with If a union employee.

pros: Labor and Delivery /MCH/WBN - I have been a nurse for 43 years.  I have never gotten tired of the opportunity to help patients and to participate in educational opportunities for staff and nursing students.   Ability to utilize my CNS advance practice degree through support of core measures and educational opportunities.
cons:
I am a floor nurse.  I still have years of productivity but my knees are wearing out.  
I have to move into a position that keeps me safe.

job_title: Environmental Services in Newport Beach, CA
pros: I've always had a wonderful experience at Kaiser from making appointments to making a trip to the urgent care with my kids. I feel like all the staff cares, and that means a lot when you're sick or when you're walking in with a sick child. They make sure they meat each individual needs and it would be a privilege to be part of a team that meats unique individuals needs
cons: I think some of the cons for me would be conflicts with schedule

job_title: Director of Technology in Pleasanton, CA
pros: Committed to patient care, leverage technology to improve business
cons: Communication from executives to staff often do not get disseminated past executives' direct reports, too much redundancies and inefficiencies, many things are project based instead of program based (meaning that once a project's funding ends, so does the work), physicians have too much influence on KP even though they are NOT employees - this presents a conflict of interest.

review_title: Good place to work with better benefits
pros: Good pay and benefits, compared to the industry,  good traning programs and some work hour flexibity.
cons: Lack of recognition for good performers, many management reorgations (20+ in 8 years), lack of communication among group and divisons, thus duplication of efforts.

review_title: Management and administration team need better communication strategies implemented
pros: Good benefits and great staff members who encourage and are always there for help and career advice. Also, the staff and members are very well connected and can help grow career.
cons: Communication between some staff members and the administration team (mostly between high ranking admin team and the regular staff) seems to be nonexistent and very mixed.

review_title: Not a job, but your life
pros: Great pay and benefits of course. Having a union is always welcomed. You also get to meet a lot of interesting people.
cons: Working at Kaiser is more like a lifestyle than a job, given how much time you will spend working. Workers take advantage of having a union to do the least amount of work possible so if you are an honest person, this sort of behavior will stress you out.

review_title: Not a job, but your life
pros: Great pay and benefits of course. Having a union is always welcomed. You also get to meet a lot of interesting people.
cons: Working at Kaiser is more like a lifestyle than a job, given how much time you will spend working. Workers take advantage of having a union to do the least amount of work possible so if you are an honest person, this sort of behavior will stress you out.

review_title: Great benefits, friendly colleagues, awesome mission
pros: Good work-life balance. I love working Oakland - convenient BART access. Awesome business model (integrated care). I was promoted 3 times in 3 years; good internal mobility if you own your career.
cons: The part of corporate offices I work in is not managed efficiently. The organization as a whole struggles to hold employees accountable. Many managers are not skilled at managing. There is fear around having real discussion. Employee development and talent management is done poorly.

pros: KP has been a pioneer in many elements of managed care. This includes the comprehensive used of an EMR long before electronic charting became mandated. Emphasis on proactive care, and consistency in disease or disorder follow up.
cons: Companies growth is exceeding staffing levels, and straining existing workflows.

review_title: You're just another cog in the machine. My years of dedicated work and service hardly gets recognized.
pros:
-Full medical and dental benefits. 
-National Holidays are recognized.
-Great retirement/401K options.
cons: Because there are so many people working for this company, your work gets diluted and unrecognized. I've seen supervisors steal credit for innovative ideas. Everyone is fighting for a raise/promotion and it is rarely given out. The state of the company is really fragile. It is a business before a health care system.

review_title: The best company I've worked for!
pros: Opportunity to grow, countless education & career advancement resources, numerous specialties to learn if you're interested in expanding your coding experience. Very supportive & encouraging management, great work environment: multicultural, respectful, team-oriented and a great combination of different talents are elements of this company .
cons: They're not remote! And you have to be patient with the department's development of new functional structures, Kaiser takes time to implement effective strategies since there's a lot of levels they need to pass.

pros: Such a diverse organization with many opportunities for professional growth and experience withing healthcare and IT sectors.
cons: Having connections and an internal network help when looking for professional career development. When there are organizational leadership changes, high performers are in a scenario where they have to re-justify their contributions and value to be considered for professional growth.

pros: Great mission, vision and values! As good as you could possibly expect, especially for such a large organization with so many employees.
cons: With large organizations comes process - KP can tend to be slow moving in comparison to many other industries. However, healthcare is understandably highly regulated. This the process is unavoidable.

job_title: Ward Clerk in Harbor City, CA
pros: Wonderful benefits, feels like a family after awhile, great pay
cons: So uncaring for the ward clerks so much added work and no appreciation for us. The Rn's get all of the great acknowlegement.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Fulton, MD
pros: Lots of growth potential.  Challenging work that makes you think. Work life balance is great. Benefits are unbeatable.  Management makes you feel valued and want to come to work and be successful.
cons: There's not much flexibility with schedules.  The seniority rules  out the union leave few opportunities too work any other shift.

pros: good pay and good benefits
cons: contrary to policy, managers of all departments definately play favorites. unions play favorites. if you do have to work overtime, they illegally cut your pay because overtime is not allowed. culture and values are in word only, not actions. no set schedule, always changing, even if a set schedule gets agreed on.

review_title: Great Place to Work in San Diego
job_title: Physician Assistant in San Diego, CA
pros: Great Autonomy!  Treated well by Physicians and Administration.  Utilized well!
cons: Admin sometimes makes decisions without the input of providers.  Part of UNAC (Nursing Union).  This can be good or bad, depending on the situation as they represent the Union members well, but not so much when it is certain problems that only effect the PA Profession, as they are mostly Nursing based.

job_title: IT Consultant II in Corona, CA
pros: Professional learning incentives get better every year.  Company wants employees to continue to learn and grow.  So many companies don't make that investment.  Kaiser does!
cons: To many positions out sourced.  I know it is a sign of the times, but wish it was more economical to give these great jobs with benefits  to Americans!

review_title: A good place to learn and grow
pros: KP is a great company to work for. Employees have a clearly defined career path and have the opportunity to pick new skills.
cons: As with any large organization, KP does have some opportunities for improvement. The organization should make the mid-senior managers more accountable - Currently that is lacking.

review_title: Good job, solid company, good people
pros: Good pay and benefits, fair amount of assigned work, dedication to work life balance.  I never felt pressured to take on more than I was willing or able to.
cons: Some lack of insight in upper management.  Sometimes felt that high level hires went to the wrong kinds of people.

job_title: Quality Improvement in Santa Clara, CA
pros: The Salary is the highest in the Region.  Benefits are excellent even if you are exempt.  Your  Coworkers who you will remember in your future endeavors
cons: Leadership is unable to demonstrate the Principles of Responsibilty.  More importantly, The Service Quality Credo of Kaiser was poorly displayed or not at all.

review_title: Enjoyed the people I worked with, dissappointed with communication from mid-level leaders.
pros: Kaiser is full of people who really care.
cons: Rewards were few and far between. Mid-level leadership is out of touch with rest of staff. Little to no opportunity to attend conferences or educational sessions. Advancement opportunities only for those in the right crowd.

pros: Company desires to be the best at operational efficiencies.  New location in Greenwood Village allows easy access for the south Denver area.   Company growth is exponential.  Great benefits.
cons: Large corporate environment makes it difficult sometimes to get work done quickly.  Very regimented in processes.  Career advancement may be difficult due to management entrenchment.

review_title: Management does not hold people accountable.
job_title: Inpatient Care Coordinator in Portland, OR
pros: Kaiser is a leader in healthcare, and a model for Universal healthcare in this country.  They offer excellent pay and benefits.  There are lots of clinics and types of jobs, from bedside nursing to research.
cons: Strong unions protect the under performers.  Management can be short-sighted and often changes to a new plan before the current plan has been fully implemented.  Organizational change is exceedingly slow.

review_title: Super happy to be part of KP!
job_title: Applications Support Analyst in Roseville, CA
pros: Great environment working with top notch colleagues and lots of opportunity for growth.
cons: My only con would be that being a health care organization I think the premiums and co-pays should be a little lower but I work in a salaried type position so I understand that this is part and parcel of being in that world.

pros: In general, it is a great company to work for that comes with stability, awesome benefits, easily accessible, and various job opportunities under one roof.
cons: Sometimes it's hard to move ahead - as the saying goes it's not what you know, but who you know. Management doesn't always have your back.

job_title: Human Resources Analyst in Alameda, CA
pros: Good benefits, just stay out of the hr service center. New VP she is changing things for the better . But lots of work to be done
cons: The HR service center does not pay well. The work environment is horrible. No trust, betrayals and management leads by bullying, intermediation  and fear. Not a professional environment at all .

pros: Pay and benefits are great
cons:
It's interesting how misogynistic some of the men working in this company can be. They call coworkers "b's" behind their backs, complain about how catty the women are and overall do not respect the women they work with. It makes it very difficult to work professionally and get things done.
Also very difficult to change jobs.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Atlanta, GA
pros: The position typically pays well. The role is generally very easy and there are some opportunities to obtain new skills.
cons: The position is a subtle step up from a customer service coordinator position. I would say that the position could be a bit more challenging. Generally due to staffing issues a PSR typically works as a CSC rather than doing PSR duties.

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Benefits are amazing, free healthcare and dental. Kaiser probably has the highest pay for CLS in California and in the US. Pension also, you cant go wrong there. Plus they give bonus when you do not call in sick for a certain number of days.
cons: Unionized so seniority is always priority so better start when you are younger so you can gain seniority. Very strict with attendance and punctuality, although thats not really a con to some people.

job_title: Senior Consultant in Woodland Hills, CA
pros: Kaiser invests in its employees. They offer good tuition reimbursement and also have many training sessions and courses in house. My managers are very attentive and really invest in their people. I have met so many great people within this organization that they feel like family.
cons: Sometimes there can be many groups working on similar initiatives and email/informational overload can also occur.

review_title: A Great Company to work for.
job_title: Senior Business Consultant in Oakland, CA
pros: It is a huge company. There are many opportunities or moving around within the company.  There are many functional group/ departments, you will definitely find one you feel comfortable to work in.
cons: The company is under a labor union environment.  There is a strong union control over the decision making process.  It is also a government like working environment.  Hence, employee performance is not measured on his/her true competence.

job_title: Business Process Manager in San Diego, CA
pros: Kaiser Permanente has a really great culture, and advocates for total health for its patients and their employees.
cons: Because they are a non-profit healthcare system, salaries, bonuses, and raises are all confined by the %  of revenue they are allowed to spend on operations versus patient care.

pros: Market leader in health care focusing on delivering health and wellness rather than sick care.  KP does things that most organizations only dream of. Forward thinking, diverse organization with good life/work balance.  Innovation here is slow but incredibly rewarding when it happens.
cons: Culture varies widely by organization, region and department.  Not as much alignment between health plan and medical groups as one might think.

job_title: Accounts Administration Representative in San Diego, CA
pros: Excellent Benefits, Great working environment, great work/life balance. Very team oriented
cons: Department goal expectations pretty high and if you don't achieve or maintain them you are fired by being escorted out of the building and your stuff mailed to you in a box.

review_title: Not the worst, but far from the best
pros: Generous health care benefits and paid time off
cons: Large bureaucracy with layers and layers of overpaid executives and directors who lack vision. KP has a very high opinion of itself as an organization, but the truth on the ground is lackluster in many ways.

review_title: Not the worst, but far from the best
pros: Generous health care benefits and paid time off
cons: Large bureaucracy with layers and layers of overpaid executives and directors who lack vision. KP has a very high opinion of itself as an organization, but the truth on the ground is lackluster in many ways.

review_title: An excellent Hospital  to get hospitalized, & to be one’s HMO.
job_title: Or RN in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Gives excellent benefits, provides room for professional growth, has a state of the art hospital equipments and supplies, very clean hospital place, and in the Top 10 for Open Heart and Hospital performance, and a great employer to work  in.
cons: One’s retired they try not to rehire.

review_title: Great Place to Work as long as You Have Patience and Can Navigate Ambiguity & Politics
pros:
Great company mission, great opportunities to find your niche in this large, diverse company.  Great opportunities to move around business units, service areas, regions / states.
The culture is really overall democratic and the employees expect to have their opinions and input solicited.
High employee satisfaction and great healthcare benefits.
cons: the politics and the long time it takes to get things done

pros: Great benefits and good work life balance.   Interesting projects to work on but very difficult to mobilize senior leadership to support initiatives.
cons: Much of the management and leadership needs to retire, which is expected in the next 7-10 years.  Once Kaiser has some more effective individuals running the organization, it might be a worthwile place to work.

pros: for the most part you co-workers are really nice and helpful, same with the customers.
cons: the union is a joke...if you report something just go ahead and box up your stuff, if it can get them ahead you co-workers will throw you under the buss the first chance they get, they will do anything they can to keep you from getting benifits.

review_title: Great place to work, but moves slowly
pros:
Great benefits with stability. Size of organization & name recognition allow for pridenof employment.
The company truly values employees and promotes work/life balance.S
cons: Difficultnto move up within the organization unless there is turn over of senior staff.  The regional differences and the addition of national program office create gaps in communication.

review_title: Kaiser is a place to start in order to get experience, but not for long-term growth and fulfillment.
pros: Healthcare benefits (including $5 co-pay for appointments and $5 prescriptions)
cons: Management is incompetent and doesn't know how to deal with its employees. It's about who you know. Management is hired or people are promoted with the best connections and relationships with others higher up.

pros: There's a lot of people there who want to change and make things happen to better improve things for not only members but also the employees.
cons: Management plays favorites and promoting those who kiss up a lot.  The company is very top heavy, so many managers who sometimes sit around and do nothing for 8 hours a day (not speculation when the manager tells you that they didn't have anything to do today).

review_title: It was great working at KP because I learned alot about healthcare(call center /customer service rep.
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Howard Manor, MD
pros: I had some great times at Kaiser Permanente working over time and growing while i am working.
cons: I just wish we could've had an hour lunch, you just get half an hour for lunch.

review_title: Great benefits, but don't expect loyalty
pros: Really good benefits (many of which kick-in the day you start). Lots of time-off accumulation. The company does try to keep a healthy environment for the workers and encourage healthy habits
cons: Questionable management - lots of useless middle manager (which takes Years to get rid of) and NO loyalty to its employees.

review_title: Great place to work, but tough if you find yourself under difficult management
pros: Stability, great 401k, employer match, health benefits / dental coverage, pension program. Lots of ability for lateral movement amongst the 15 medical centers in Northern California.
cons: Bureaucracy, complacency, redundant systems, management not sticking up for front line employees enough in the absence of a union to represent certain employees.

pros:
Work environment promotes patient care and employee care.
Pays above average compared to other hospitals in the area.
A lot of growth potential.
cons:
Presenting new ideas and getting them applied can be difficult, do to an older long lasting culture.
Your voice depends on seniority regardless of your ideas being solid or not.

pros: Competitive pay. Unionized. Strict loyalty to current employees. RN morale is overall higher than RNs at competition hospitals. Outstanding benefits.
cons: The expectations of management are very high because the standard of care is very high. It can sometimes seem as though your best is not enough.

pros: It's Kaiser, pure brand recognition. If you want tools then they will provide them for you. If you want to grow your career, go to Kaiser.
cons: Lack of focus and lack of communication. Projects always changing scope based on an outside stakeholder's whim even when the project is close to completion. Three managers with different agendas.

pros: The manager is a very kind, compassionate woman who genuinely cares about her employees. They also care for their customers/patients and stay on the cutting edge of what's happening. I would definitely be willing to work there again.
cons: There aren't many cons about working as a prenatal educator for Kaiser Permanente. The biggest con I can think of is that the jobs are all part time so there are no benefits including no paid time off.

job_title: Director, Technology and Support in Latham, NY
pros: Kaiser invests in its people.  They encourage employee development through Individual Development Plans to focus on an employees ambitions and invests in the individuals that want to seek out opportunities.  They are family oriented, offer amazing benefits and you feel good working for a nonprofit that actually gives back billions of dollars to the communities it serves.  I've been with Kaiser for almost 23 years and I look forward to another 25.
cons: I have no cons to offer.

job_title: Financial Analyst in Long Beach, CA
pros: Kaiser provides great benefits to employees (including health benefits, time off [which starts at 21 days per year], and a stable company. The employees absolutely believe in the company's mission.
cons: Just like other juggernauts, Kaiser is a company where there are many "established" leaders set in their ways, and it is almost impossible to make any sort of meaningful change.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Great salary, benefits and patients. I have loved my career with Kaiser
cons:
They harass employees for simple issues that do not need "fact findings". This is a ridiculous way of taking on issues. 
they expect you to do the work of 2-3 nurses because you are paid well.

job_title: Project Analyst in Los Angeles, CA
pros: BENEFITS! The health coverage is great with almost nothing coming out of pocket. The best part is the amount of paid vacation that the organization pays for. Starting is 4 weeks a year, and it only goes up from there.
cons: It is a very large organization so be prepared to experience the typical pains of working for a bureaucracy. Things move very slowly.

job_title: Systems Administrator in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Kaiser Permanente is a preventative care based healthcare provider that serves their communities with a comprehensive approach to wellness. They begin by engaging employees at all levels of the organization through training, employee/management partnerships and an extensive benefits package.
cons: I worked with Kaiser for 15 years and the only reason I left was because I moved out if the area. My experience with them was always a great one.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Vallejo, CA
pros: higher compensation than some. Expanding Kaiser position. Recent purchase in Seattle and Maui
cons: Kaiser is in a skinny down mode with staff currently. Many cut positions, exited positions are not replaced or are replaced with nurses new to Kaiser to reset the pay scale. Kaiser Managers are micromanagers per Kaiser standards, which does not always set well with each manager

pros: Excellent medical benefits! Hands down the best ever! Thank you
cons: Management sucks big time because there are too much politics. Also, it's very hard to be promoted. My advice recommendation is to make as many friends as possible that how you'll get promoted.

review_title: FAVORITISM AND NEPOTISM: GET READY TO DEAL WITH UNFAIR TREATMENT
pros: Benefits are decent, no weekends
cons: Every nurse is title-driven with their nose up in the air. So if you are not an RN you are considered an MA/ CNA tech or Housekeeping. Management encourage unfair treatment in fear of losing so called good nurses. Also, you are required to do the housekeeping job, your job and typical MA duties.

job_title: Surgery Scheduler in San Jose, CA
pros: You get really good benefits at Kaiser. The pay is good if you live in an area like the central valley or Northern California.
cons:
I make the same as my counterparts in cheaper areas. So while I would live comfortably in Sacramento or the central valley, I struggle living in the Bay Area.
Vacation is extremely hard to get unless you are on top of the seniority list. If somebody in your department is off (same position) good luck getting approved.

review_title: Kaiser Permanente: RN 2 triage, charge and ED nurse
pros: Love the people I work with. Able to expedite patient care with my experience. Able to provide the care I would like for myself or family
cons: Work full time with skeleton crew at night. 21 rooms, no tech, no RT, three RNS and one ED Doc and boarding patients awaiting admission even to ICU

pros: Working at Kaiser employee has work life balance. Kaiser is one of the leaders in setting high Healthcare standards, high quality service for our members & community and provides affordable care. In IT, we have lot of cutting edge technologies to explore and innovate cool solutions for improving healthcare services.
cons: You have to be in the right team with your expertise.

review_title: Operator promoted to imaging assistant promoted to bone density technician
pros:
Competitive pay
Tuition reimbursement/advance your career opportunity 
Union pushes to overcome barriers with management 
Benefits are paid by employer
Top preventative care company
cons:
Understaffed 
High management turnover 
Seniority-based for future job changes
Union versus non-union management 
Technology and equipment needs updating 
HR not in a mutual state between non-union 
management and union staff

pros: Excellent health and time off benefits. Working with some of the newest software and computers available. Plenty of training.
cons: Way to bureaucratic, upgrades of equipment happen but every 3 years. Any decision must be approved by at least 3 levels of management. Very slow to adapt to new procedures/techniques.

job_title: Admitting Representative-Bed Control Clerk in Modesto, CA
pros: I have worked for Kaiser Permanente for just over 5 years. They are great company that has been nothing but supportive in helping move toward my career goals, including helping me pay for my Masters degree. They have also been a dream to work with during two maternity leaves.
cons: The NorCal Central Valley recruitment office needs improvement. It is very hard to get any information or get through to a live person on the phone.

review_title: Great benefits, great pay.. annoying job
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Duluth, GA
pros:
The pay is one of the best paying for this kind of job.
The benefits are pretty good
cons: Management doesn’t know much of anything but they know numbers and seems to be all they care about. The communication can be a lot better

review_title: Ask a lot of questions during your KPIT interview.
pros: You get your own office in the Pleasanton buildings.  Public transportation is readily available.  Work from home is available and you get your own cell phone so you can be reached 7x24.  KPIT has a large IT budget and I have not seen any layoffs when I was there but you also get deadwoods hanging around not carrying his own weight.  The engineers are bright and hard working especially the ones from India.  They work and work without complains but there are also deadwoods.  Pay and bonuses are decent.
cons:
Management, definitely management.  In KPIT my department's management structure mainly consists of managers with India background.  They are pretty technical people but really have no sense of what it takes to be managers.  They hang together and they whisper and pass information back and forth among themselves. They definitely know their pecking orders.  If an Indian IT Director says jump the Sr. Indian Managers would say how high and then in turn he tells his reporting Indian manager to jump x number of feet and he would in turn tell the rank and file engineers to jump x number of feet.  They follow their superior's orders blindly and expects their subordinates to do the same.  They are very results conscious.  That means you are expected to do 60 hour work weeks for months at a time with no time off (and your comp times you are expected to carry your cell phones) to complete your tasks.  

These are not managers with "your" career goals in their best interest.  They are concern with looking good in front of their customers/stakeholders so they too can become Directors and Sr managers.  Mangers will say one thing to you and turn around say something else to the stakeholders to make themselves look good.  If you are on the team and make a mistake with the stakeholders there is no way they will step up to protect you the employee.   They will literally hang you out to dry just to ensure your mistake does not make them look bad and stall their career advancement.  These managers are very political and they are very good at playing the political game and they know what it takes to ensure you don't make them look bad.  

Probably not all of KPIT is like this but in this IT department in Pleasanton that was what I observed and experienced for 2 years.  If you get an offer with KPIT in Pleasanton I would highly recommend speaking with the sw engineers and support engineers to understand what the working environment is all about.  Once a week you are expected to work a 12 hour shift doing support (they don't ever tell you this during your interview.  They also do not tell you that your are expected to be available 7x24 either).  Don't get fool with the KPIT recruiter and recruiting web site presenting the job description as the best thing for your career.   Do not make the same mistake I made!

review_title: Working at Kaiser was a mostly positive experience, but not without flaws.
pros: Amazing health benefits were offered, as well as a modest pension plan, which is rare to find these days in corporate America.  Kaiser also started to actively promote a healthy lifestyle, with neat programs and a Friday Farmers Market.
cons: Managers often seemed rather unqualified for the jobs they were expected to perform, and had little oversight from senior management.  Often my department seemed very disorganized, almost like a ship without a captain.

review_title: Strong culture, either you fit in or you don't
pros: Everyone is typically very friendly and it is easy to build relationships if you are outgoing. Also, the benefits, especially for represented employees are excellent.
cons: The culture does not lend itself well to being ran like a business. It can be a challenge for leaders to be effective in terms of driving for results.

pros: Good benefits.  Established company. High rate of integrity and desire to do the right thing.
cons: Healthcare jobs can flop when the economy downturns.  Be prepared to learn the Kaiser way, it's not like any other company anywhere else.  Kaiser's motto is if you do a good job, we'll give you more work (long hours).

review_title: Working for Kasier has it's ups and downs, but i feel very lucky to have a stable flexible job with raises every year.
pros: Great for learning and growing.
cons: They have a very strict sick policy at the hospital I work at, it depends on where you work though

pros: Frankly, I don't see any. Very cheap when it comes to employee relations.
cons: Just like most big companies they broughht some henchman in to cut jobs and remove higher salaried employees and bring in new people to do twice the work as before at less pay. If it sounds like I'm bitter, I am. 25 years with a company and shown the door. I wish nothing but the worse for AG.

review_title: Very tough place to work in management
pros: Lots of opportunities to transfer within the company. If you are liked by those in power.  If not, you will not have the opportunity.
cons: There are a lot of politics and senior leaders who should have gone away long ago. Lots of buzz words used, but little to no action.

pros: Great pay, benefits are good, paid holidays, Holiday pay is great, union to back you up (sometimes).
cons: Company is always trying to lay off employees, lack of communication from management, Pay Union dues but Union does crap for nurses.  They can transfer you to any center with a 30 days notice.  They don't care where you live or how far you have to travel.

pros: They used to be a cutting edge company in Healthcare industry.  Not anymore, not sure if executives has right vision and strategy to bring back KP that is affordable, modern and  innovative.
cons: With competition and market pressure, KP (IT) has lot of pressure and need to fix broken processes.  There are so many broken, and inefficient process.   Very cumbersome and slow organization who cannot make the decision quick enough and always fall behind the market trend.

review_title: • Maintained inventory of clinic supplies needed to administer shots.
job_title: Medical Assistant in Mission Hills, CA
pros: Kaiser is a great place to work i really enjoyed working with kaiser Permanente. employees make you feel welcome.
cons: Their are great benefits of working with kaiser is that their is great people working their and they work as a family. If their was challenges i didn't notice them i was very comfortable.

pros: An amazing organization that walks the talk and has innovative and compassionate staff who focus on keeping the member experience at the center of all the decisions we make.  This is the type of place you can be proud to be affiliated with and go to be at night knowing you made a positive impact on people's lives.
cons: Very complex matrix organization so there is a learning curve for new employees. Requires patience as you learn.

pros: Good benefits and retirement plans.  Lots of department to move around.  Great educational assistance program.  Flexibility in some departments and has different shifts.
cons: Seems like every two years they reorg in some departments that is it hard to predict if you will have a job or not.

job_title: Staff Nurse III in Portland, OR
pros: Kaiser offers excellent benefits.  I've been employed with them in Northern California and also, currently, in the Northwest Region.  I prefer the dynamic of the Northern California region most of all so far.
cons: I do not see any downside to working for Kaiser Permanente.  It's a great company.  The unions are strong and well represented.  Any cons would have to be specific to subpar employee performance or to poor management.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Kaiser Permanente  is a very large integrated healthcare organization with two distinct parts 1) Care Delivery  2) Health Plan Insurance.  Both are good to work for and provide many opportunities and benefits.
cons: As with any very large organization there is a level of bureaucracy, however, efforts are taken to break down the silos and make the organization more efficient.

review_title: Decent people in a large IT bureaucracy
job_title: IT Management in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Most people are decent and hard-working; very few outright jerks.
Large variety of technologies in use.
cons: Big bureaucracy.  Little sense among management that the size of the bureaucracy is a big part of the problem.   Heavy reliance on contractors and consultants.  Not much courage to develop inhouse expertise, although an internship program has been started recently, which is a good step.

pros: I have worked for Kaiser for 30 years and followed a great growth of Kaiser into a preventive illness organization. Union was alway there to balance issues if any with management as far as cost cuts and reduced pensions etc. Earned my RNP as RN with Kaiser education help (pay and time off)
cons: As questions about future costs of health care Kaiser is like other HMO's in cutting costs that do affect some benefits for future employees.

job_title: Senior Systems Analyst in Atlanta, GA
pros: I love that we can telecommute 99.9%.  Benefits are great and in addition, there is a company funded pension.
cons: Depending on your Director, promotions are hard to come by.

pros: Leadership does a great job recognizing staff
cons: The politics within kasier can turn you off. To much red tape, paper work and policy changes.

pros: pay is the highest, great pharmacists, and opportunities for growth.  once in, the benefits are really great.  Def dont want to go anywhere else.
cons: there are certain departments that squeeze the heck out of you in terms of hours worked...hello we have school too...although not as bad as los angeles center

pros: Great benefits, salary and people!  Working in IT was an extremely rewarding position.  Challenges with process hinder progress but when items complete it's a great feeling what we are doing for our staff and members.
cons: It's not about hard work, it's about people networking. Too many procedures that hamper progress. Processes for processes could be reduced to improve efficiency.

pros: There is ample opportunity to maintain a healthy life/work balance.  Their benefits are some of the best in the business.
cons: Management positions seem to attract some of the less competent people available for those positions (and they're often hired).  The value placed on advanced degrees, rather than real-world experience, leads to poor promotion and hiring choices.

review_title: Positive for career advancement but based on who you know, not necessarily one's intelligence or knowledge.
job_title: Senior Consultant in Oakland, Charleston, SC
pros: Good Work/Life  Balance but depends upon your direct manager.  Great benefits: Pension Plan; Strong Kaiser Healthcare Model creates lots of growth opportunities and career advancement for most people.
cons: Often career advancement is based on who you know.  Difficult for those who are not good at networking to advance within the organization.

review_title: What's good is really good, but is bad is sheer hell on earth.
pros: Provides a decent benefit package; large company so they offer a variety of programs to employees;  opportunities to transfer within company.
cons: Raises are minimal unless in senior management;  Talks a good game about wanting employees to thrive but doesn't back up in reality;  managers lack basic human management skills and the enterprise doesn't care.

review_title: Acceptable work environment. Can be better.
pros: Good benefits. Pension provision. Generous vacation time at the start. Broad project types to expand skill set. People are supportive and knowledgeable. Job security--healthcare products never die!
cons: Slow career advancement. Pay not as competitive compared to the industry. Need to diversify work place. Staff don't usually speak their mind.

review_title: Keep your head down and work seems a risky montra for the Kaiser future.
pros: Social networking (Ideabook) facilitating cultural change. Enterprise architecture preparing for the new Kaiser.  Great health database.
cons: Unstable management, innovation is not encouraged, HR trying to push change that they do not know the impact. HR likes to give test to filter out existing employee personalities.

review_title: Great place to work. Great life-work balance!
job_title: Data Consultant in San Jose, CA
pros: I like working at Kaiser Permanente. It offers me the chance to learn new things and solve problems using my analytical skills. Great work life balance. Great medical benefits, too!
cons: Sometimes your skill set is overlooked but you need to be assertive in pushing your ideas specially if you know it will be effective and will benefit the members.

pros: The culture, mission, medical directors, salary, and benefits were excellent.
cons: The lower level management (directors and managers) of our team was ineffective.  They resorted to emotionally-based decisions and lacked objectivity.  It was stressful due to the impact of the ACA and they lacked resilience and integrity under pressure.

review_title: What it's like to work for KP
pros: Good Health Care, good retirement (if you last that long) and the pay is just OK.
cons: Management has their own agenda no matter what they tell you.  They work their physicians into the ground and then expect more from them.

review_title: Nurse Practitioner in clinical setting seeing Adult Med/internal Medicine patients.
pros: Collegial atmosphere, working with supportive MDs & Staff.  Many educational opportunities in-house by recognized Specialists.  Absolutely great patient-to-NP relationship.
cons: High patient load for NPs and MDs.  No overtime pay for NPs.  Unfortunately, MDs have to work overtime & from home but don't receive overtime pay.

review_title: Exceptional pay but horrible working conditions
pros: The pay and benefits at the Northern California hospitals can't be beat!
cons: The staffing ratios are very unsafe. On your days off you'll get a phone call from staffing to see if you want to work. They will ask you nearly every shift if you want to work overtime. I often go to work filled with dread and fear for my license- high acuity, high census, low staffing!!

review_title: Exceptional pay but horrible working conditions
pros: The pay and benefits at the Northern California hospitals can't be beat!
cons: The staffing ratios are very unsafe. On your days off you'll get a phone call from staffing to see if you want to work. They will ask you nearly every shift if you want to work overtime. I often go to work filled with dread and fear for my license- high acuity, high census, low staffing!!

pros: Great leadership running this organization.  Good people and very good benefits.
cons: Not the highest payer in terms of salary but the benefits make up for it.

pros: Benefits and you can move around the company
cons: Hiring takes forever. Outdated computer systems. Management that is stuck in the 90's. Limited to 13-15 % pay increase if you move to  higher position.   There is no "thriving" for the employees. Almost every department is consistently understaffed. Work life balance is only for upper management.

review_title: Great work life balance. Good nurses and doctors.
job_title: Staff RN in San Francisco, CA
pros: Good work life balance. I feel like the nurses and staff in general are really happy to work here- which helps with patient satisfaction.
cons: Protocols are good but sometimes patients presenting with atypical  symptoms can be missed or not caught as quickly if the symptoms are outliers outside of protocols.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great benefits. Kaiser is trying to promote healthy eating and exercise, which is amazing move for one hospital.
cons: Have been working for the company for the past 6 years. Applied to over 35 positions in the past year after completing my degree, but unbelievably impossible to grow. Once you are in one  specific department, you will be stuck there forever unless you quit, of course.

job_title: Front End Developer in Oakland, CA
pros: Kaiser Permanente is a company where you can find co-workers with a lot of experience in Front End Development. For sure they will be better than you if you have less than 10 years of experience, but you can learn from them so much that your skills will improve very fast. I really recommend them, so if you have job offer from Kaiser do not think too much, accept it!!!
cons: I can not say any conses.

review_title: Kaiser is a great place for healthcare...just don't plan to work for them if you want to develop and grow your career
pros:
Great place to learn how to manage a others. 

You learn on the job...if you pay attendation to how the Directors and Senoir leadership manage teams, and then you do the opposite, you'll be a valued leader (in another complay) one day.
cons: While I hope this was not purposeful, it is questionable, given the lack of authentic leadership quick to blame/shame staff. how pervasive lack of true leadership

job_title: Clinical Dietitian in San Jose, CA
pros: Benefits are great when you are employed as benefit eligible and if you are senior
cons: On Call staff does not get much recognition or benefits. You have to be happy with your hourly wage. Seniority plays a big role at Kaiser hospitals. The longer you stay better off you are

review_title: Retaining Talent and Building for the Future?
pros: Large company with many challenges for those who thrive on challenge.
cons: Managers react to what senior mangement wants at the moment, but have little foresight to planning and budgeting.

review_title: Opportunity for growth. Allowed to excel.
job_title: Senior Elearning Instructional Designer in Pleasanton, CA
pros: Excellent health plan. Overall job security. Country-wide enterprise provides for opportunity to advance career. Company is committed to employee health and work / life balance.
cons: Typical troubles found in all large corporations. Size of corporation precludes ability to be nimble. Too large a middle management structure. In-fighting and ivory tower syndrome.

review_title: Kaiser Permanente is a not-for-profit Health Care provider that is positioned to be a leader even more so with the ACA.
pros: As a one stop shop for health insurance, physicians / staff, and facilities with over 50 years of medical data Kaiser Permanente can truly focus on positive outcomes and make people thrive.
cons: The not-for-profit environment can be sluggish to move and cause challenges for candidates who want a fast paced work environment.

review_title: Poor management, emphasis on lowering costs, not on security.
job_title: Information Security Engineer in Pleasanton, CA
pros: Good benefits, lots of flexibility, at least while I was there.  Fairly advanced for the healthcare space, but doesn't approach banks / pharma / etc.
cons: Hard to get promoted, security is on the back burner, lots of unmanaged devices that vendors won't patch.  They want cheap, new people over senior, expensive folks.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst in Portland, OR
pros: Very collaborative with a strong focus on health and doing the best thing for the patient and their family. They're very focused on supporting your health as well, including a healthy work-life balance.
cons: It is healthcare, so there's always more to do than there are resources to get it all done. However, I've never had an issue here with everything being the "top prioirty," so there is understanding that it can't all be done at once.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Portland, OR
pros: Great benefits, good access to training & supplies, almost always staffed good
cons: Managers are not there to be friends, they are paid to make changes, even where the situation is fine, can't trust & the constant term "team" is a lie.

pros: Great benefits.  Flexible work schedule.  Easy Access to all Services.  Dedicated Clinical providers.  Preventive health care.  Great retirement.  Educational opportunities
cons: Disconnect between Administration and Clinical Practice.  Can be understaffed at times.  Small fish in a large pond.  Too little time for appointments.  Great for acute health care but can be difficult to navigate for chronic health issues

pros: Once you are in the KP family there are many opportunities for advancement and growth. The company offers learning options online and training classes.
cons: So many unions it makes your head spin! There is a union for every group of workers and they recently added at least one more. That really makes it difficult to make changes.

job_title: IT Project Manager in Oakland, CA
pros: Healthcare has lots of opportunities for an IT professional as the industry is playing catch up. There is lots of room for growth and lots of need.
cons: One of my favorite managers once told me that healthcare has destroyed many careers. Kaiser is one of those places to take caution as it is a heavily politicized environment.

job_title: Outpatient Pharmacist in Santa Rosa, CA
pros:
+ great pay
+ lots of help 
+ union (pro and con)--protection from the union/ difficult to be let go 
+ great benefits
+ clock in and clock out--you don't feel over-exhausted
cons:
+ union (pro and con)--everybody gets paid the same rate. no incentive to improve
+ working lot a lot of people can be frustrating when people are slacking off

pros: Although the average age skews higher, everyone at the company is happy. Turnover is very low and the average tenure is quite high. Amazing benefits and plenty of room to grow. The company is very focused on employee health and happiness.
cons: Although a leader in healthcare, the company follows in everything else. Technology is far behind and becomes an almost daily issue.

review_title: Extreme potential waiting to be enabled
pros: Indisputable mission & vision - Wealth of expertise hungry for consistent and engaged leadership - platform capable to impact healthcare well beyond KP covered lives
cons: Misaligned incentives between geographies and functions limit potential - Mid level executive roles lack sufficient authority - Insufficient investment in ongoing operations in comparison to new assets (technology, facilities, etc)

pros: It's a great organization that has a very good purpose and goal of healthcare.  They provide very good healthcare and I was proud to be part of that process.
cons: For Clinical Technology, the upper leadership does not understand the workings of a service organization.  A lot of patience is required to get through the procedures set up to accomplish the work.

job_title: Hospice RN Case Manager in Vallejo, CA
pros: Kaiser requires utmost  professionalism in their employees. The  unit I worked with had the best clinical staff home health aides and clerical staff.The pharmacists and physicians were a wonderful resource.They supplies and resources and education were amole to do my job
cons: A lot  of oversight and fear of not passing licensing and JACHO  makes  people in management panic

pros: Team work, job security, Beni fits and decent pay.  Every facility I’ve been to has been clean and well kept. Kaiser also seems to keep current with cutting age technology. Computerized charting in addition is constantly improving with upgrades.
cons: Staffing issues can be a concern at times.  We need to hire more young new nurses with training programs geared toward novices nurses.

review_title: Great first year before all the management changes
job_title: Bilingual Medical Assistant in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great benefits, good team in my module, mostly only back office work, trainings
cons: Seniority runs the whole organization. Vacation time, ed leave and growth opportunities are extremely limited for those starting fresh. You need 20 years with them in order to be able to bid for other opportunities.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in San Diego, CA
pros: Very well compensated, networking opportunities, customer service experience, multi-tasking, great foot in the door if you're in school or considering career growth within the medical field.
cons: Face of the company so you have to deal with angry, frustrated, sick, and upset patients. Seniority based (vacation wise). Encourage online classes only (accommodation wise).

pros: Great work/life balance and autonomy and flexibility. Amazing community partner.  A leader in innovations in the industry. Equitable pay. Great benefits. Opportunity for upward mobility.
cons: A bit old school when it comes to the physical environment.  Need to 'contemporize' workspaces.  Lacking in culture for younger employees.

pros: Kaiser Permanente provides quality health care to its members, and strives to do its best on a continual basis.
cons: Very difficult while transferring to another Kaiser.

pros: My 43 years of service with Kaiser Hawai'i has been rewarding, the Patient Care level is over and above, compensation and benefits are comparable to Hawai'i Health Care Industry. I believe in TEAM work moto "It takes a village" and have had the opportunity with being in the village.!
cons: Rapid changes, I believe in change however Kaiser Permanente Hawai'i change demands have become challenging and fearful for many in the Hawai'i region.

review_title: Pay is awesome, management is puppeted by superiors.
job_title: Emergency Room Registration in San Francisco, CA
pros:
*Pay is excellent
*Friendly people
*Employer reputation is highly regarded
cons:
*Management always at meetings 
*Staff in-put on problems not always regarded seriously
*'Big Brother' type atmosphere from management and above

pros: Good pay and benefits.  Believe in the Kaiser model for health care.
cons: Poor management who rely on threats and micro-management.  Believe there is a shift in manangement at Kaiser Vallejo with the idea of getting rid of older experienced workers.  A lot of conflict between workers and management -the politics makes it difficult to concentrate on patient care.

review_title: IT Professional - improve management and delivery of IT services to support all KP business units.
pros: Immense opportunity to improve entire IT landscape through technology investments, operational improvements, and strategic planning with business partners.
cons: 1) The antiquated federated organization model and generally weak IT executive leadership make it difficult to achieve cost effective change across all IT portfolios.  2)  Poor relationship  with KP business units an Medical groups create unnecessary conflicts.

review_title: Cares about members, moves slow like the government
pros: Kaiser cares about their members almost to a fault.  High quality care. Tries to promote health and wellness with employees.  Good room for growth at company - promotes from within. Has a pension program.
cons: Getting anything done means crossing so much red tape.  Too many talking heads, not easy to make decisions.  Pay and 403b match is not as high as other insurances companies.

job_title: Desktop Support Lead in Pasadena, CA
pros: Pros are salary and benefits
cons: Desktop support department is Union based and run by a some very unprofessional management teams. Work life balance is not as the company dictates and growth is quite difficult within the Desktop Support group.

job_title: Lab Assistant II in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: I learned a lot of skills that I will take to any future jobs. The employee benefits a amazing! The union works out a great contract for the employees.
cons: I didn't get the chance to practice the amazing skills I learned  while at Kaiser. Getting vacation days was next to impossible and you have to plan 15 months in advance.

job_title: Patient Registration Associate in Denver, CO
pros: Kaiser Pays well and the Health benefits are awesome.
cons: Worst management EVER! They break you down. Work against you. Don't build you up at all.  I find it hard to move around. Yes, there are plenty of open positions, but they already have a person in mind for that specific position.

pros: Kaiser Permanente truly cares about their employees and all of their members. Everyone always has a smile on their face, even in a dramatic environment such as a hospital. I was surprised by all the perks of working for this organization even as an intern.
cons: Honestly in my opinion, there are no issues with the organization. Sometimes there is trouble finding parking for the members when the hospital is busy but that isn't always the case.

pros: Healthcare is a great place for job stability.  Another benefit is that health care, dental and vision care is extremely low.  Very large organization with room for advancement.
cons: Meetings, there are a ton of meetings. Many times a simple topic that can be easily done by email or phone requires a meeting.

review_title: Good people, incredibly awful and invasive application process for non-union staff
pros: People, many challenges to tackle, opportunities for other work
cons: Hiring process, HR, invasive application process (requiring you "tell us every salary you've ever had", for example), outdated technology and processes, many layers of bureaucracy and obstruction, poor technology support, overcrowded building and offices, more

review_title: Get out the Contact Center when you can...
job_title: Specialty Appointment Coordinator in Duluth, GA
pros:
Great pay, Kaiser Benefits, UNION coverage
Try to keep up the fun atmosphere with themes
Give out Kudos to brag about how good some associates are
cons: Rude members, managers are not the best. Some members of Management forget that they started out in the associates position same as we did.

job_title: Physician Assistant in San Jose, CA
pros: The medical benefits are good.
cons: The pay for PA’s at Kaiser is average but below average for specialty PA’s. The bonus structure for PA’s is very poor/pathetic . Socialistic pay structure, Poor employees are not disciplined and excellent employees are not rewarded for their performance. Basically everyone is paid the same regardless of their specialty or individual performance.

review_title: So many built in advantages, but very slow to move because everything is a priority.
job_title: Director IT Consulting in Portland, OR
pros: People really want to do the right thing.  Lots of sharp friendly people.
cons: HR and IT need complete overhauls.  The labor unions can be an anchor to progress.  Senior leadership needs better business acumen.  Doctors have too much say in non-clinical matters.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Denver, CO
pros:
Lunch hours are more than encouraged
Paid benefits
Union backing & bargaining
cons: Currently going through a "Transformation" process. Fancy words for a lay offs. Refusing to negotiate with Unions, trying to fire all non essential staff. Trying to weasel ways to fire nurses. Refusal to follow none retaliation policies, and no accountability. Required to bid for vacation time and year in advance

pros: efficient health care system; good salary and benefits; smart colleagues
cons: ruthless management practices will make you feel like you'd be treated better at the local McDonald's.  And you would.  Think hard before working here. Life's too short. The money isn't worth it.  The phony culture will culture will make you want to take a bath.

review_title: Great mission and vision - proud to work for KP
pros: Executive leadership walks the walk. With what is going on in the world, I am heartened to see our leadership commit to racial justice and access to affordable and high quality healthcare.
cons: Not as nimble due to size. In some cases, very siloed so there ends up being a lot of duplication of effort. They are trying but it is like turning a battleship.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Happy Valley, OR
pros: Cheap healthcare for employees. Competitive pay.
cons: Management, like many other hospital systems, are all about the money and not so much the care. You jump through many hoops to get the care you need if a specialist is involved. Delayed care is also prevalent. Good luck with internships if you’re looking to transition to another field, opportunity is rare to come.

pros: The mission:  provide quality and affordable healthcare to our members and the communities we serve.  Many people who work at Kaiser are very committed to this mission.  There are many compassionate people.  Once the organization sets its mind to do something, the results are phenomenol.
cons: It is a large organization and creating change can be challenging.

review_title: Great company that lacks good leadership.
pros: Great company, great benefits, stable.
cons:
Easy to get pigeon-holed in a position because there isn't a clear
Career path. Poor marketing leadership on the national and local level.

review_title: Depending on your department, there might be no work life balance
pros: The compensation package is decent. Health coverage is great and the people that you work with are sensational.  Many are knowledgeable and willing to provide you with support when needed.
cons: Kaiser is very departmentalized.  There are a lot of red tapes which are understandable since it is a fairly large company.

review_title: A full opportunity to combine technology, people, and process for better patient outcomes!
pros: We are the Accountable Care Organization that Health Care Reform talks about.  And, we can and will do better for patient and member outcomes.
cons: We are a gigantic company and it is sometimes hard to get things done, but our motto in our region includes "lead from where you stand"!

pros: The team of people with whom I worked who were on the same level as me.
cons: Managers and Directors / Sr. Management Personnel Lack of Listening to employees

pros: Kaiser is very good to their employees.  Benefits are amazing.  They also really care about members and providing the best service at the best price.  I've worked for Kaiser for over 7 years and have always felt well compensated and appreciated.
cons: It takes a long time to get anything done.  There are also a lot of politics that seem to hinder progress.

review_title: Typical large organization - slow to change
pros: Part of a great health plan provider and a group of passionate people. There are multiple differentiators that set KP apart and it is wonderful to be apart of the KP mission.
cons: Ask about how long the members of the team have been under manager.  If there has been turnover,  there is a reason. Find another position to apply for.

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Raleigh, NC
pros: Excellent benefits and salaries with well maintained working conditions.  Constantly looking to grow and improve safety and efficiency.  Highly rated in HMO customer satisfaction surveys.
cons: Often there is disconnect between Regional and Local management on goals and implementation of strategies.  Difficult to get changes to happen from the bottom up.

job_title: Intermediate Project Manager in Chicago, IL
pros: Mission-driven organization, diverse workforce, work-life balance, room for professional growth and development, an organization you can retire from, bright, talented, and interesting colleagues.
cons: The organization is working its people hard as of late post-ACA passing. Work-life balance isn't as easy to find as it once was at KP. Not all leaders are skilled in recognizing opportunities for professional development for their employees.

job_title: Project Manager II in Deerfield, IL
pros: The company provides great benefits, retirement and lots of time off.  I've been with the company approximately 8 years and receive about 6 weeks of combined vacation and sick time off per year.
cons: Large, segmented company with many layers of management.  Sometimes difficult to move forward with projects due to the number of approvals required.

pros: The experience really was enriching and helped me with my college applications. it also led me to know what I wanted to be in the future.
cons: The hours are really low so if you're trying to work a lot you won't be able to as shifts are 3 hours.

job_title: Computer Programmer Analyst in San Diego, CA
pros:
Flexible hours,  great Medical benefits.  Employer match 401k plan.  
Cafeteria food is inexpensive and always available.
Health Care is an noble profession and the team environment throughout the Hospital shows!
cons:
Some of the upcoming projects seem to be too low in the stack.
The deadlines are difficult to meet when precious time is wasted on the non-compliance issues.

job_title: Administrative Assistant III in San Jose, CA
pros:
Free benefits for singles 
Pay 
Meet some nice people 
Professional office environment
cons:
Cliques and favoritism 
Lack of growth opportunities 
Non challenging work 
Lazy tenures who have been with company for 20 plus years and don't want to change or feel the need to change 
Dishonest management 
IT is slow and the process outdated

review_title: Not all Kaisers are the same. Sometimes the rumors are true.
pros: Good  health, dental and 401 k plan
cons: Depending on the facility, outcomes are more important than the staff that care for the patients. Staff are eventually are licensed bodies and nothing more than that.

review_title: My experience has been a struggle since day one in the home health/palliative/hospice department.
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Excellent benefits that include the highest wages in the region, full health and dental, 401k, and a pension. The union is strong and will protect you.
cons: Toxic work environment, micromanagement, and hostility from management. Staff work off the clock to keep up with the paperwork. Expect to spend excessive time documenting communications with management because they will use anything they can to go after you.

review_title: My experience has been a struggle since day one in the home health/palliative/hospice department.
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Excellent benefits that include the highest wages in the region, full health and dental, 401k, and a pension. The union is strong and will protect you.
